label: Machine Learning
headline: AI Fundamentals
description: Machine learning is all about teaching computers to learn from data. It covers the core algorithms, data processing, and how models are trained to make predictions.

children.label: Algorithm Types
children.headline: Learning Methods
children.description: There are different ways to teach machines - some learn from labeled examples, others find patterns on their own. This covers supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and neural networks.

children.label: Applications
children.headline: Real-World Uses
children.description: Machine learning is everywhere now - it powers recommendation systems, helps computers see images, and understands human language. Companies use it to solve real business problems.

children.label: Tools & Frameworks
children.headline: Development Platforms
children.description: You need the right tools to build ML models. TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn are the most popular libraries. Cloud platforms make it easier to train and deploy models.

children.label: Research Areas
children.headline: Cutting-Edge Research
children.description: Researchers are pushing the boundaries with deep learning, transfer learning, and explainable AI. They're also tackling important questions about ethics and fairness in AI systems.
